intro: Solenanthus bakhtiaricus, commonly known as the Bakhtiar's solenanthus, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in rocky or well-drained soils at elevations above 1,500 meters. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
